did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Shenandoah County poll books dating to the 1870s.
did.origination: Lee Township, New Market, Shenandoah County

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of Item], The New Market Poll Books, 1873-1879, SC# 2089, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Purchased by Friends of Carrier Library on July 23, 1994.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Purchased by Friends of Carrier Library at Green Valley Auction Barn near Mt. Crawford, July 23, 1994.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Poll books were used as a record of citizens who voted in elections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains one folder of ten poll books for elections held in New Market, Lee Township/Magisterial District, Shenandoah County, VA, in May and November 1873, November 1874, May and November 1875 and 1877, November 1878, and May and November 1879. Each book is paperbound and contains the oaths of judges and clerks of the election and signatures of electors.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The poll books are arrange chronologically.
